toppingRecipes.name: Classic Margherita

ingredients.name: Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste

method: Mix the tomato sauce with salt and pepper to taste.
Tear or slice the mozzarella into thin pieces.
Have the basil leaves ready to add after baking.
After baking, drizzle with olive oil and scatter fresh basil leaves.

toppingRecipes.name: Pepperoni
method: Mix dried oregano into the tomato sauce.
Arrange pepperoni slices evenly over the cheese.

toppingRecipes.name: Supreme

ingredients.name: (25g) sliced bell peppers (mix of red and green)

method: Mix dried Italian herbs into the tomato sauce.
Sauté mushrooms, bell peppers, and onions for 2-3 minutes until slightly softened.
Arrange all toppings evenly over the cheese.

toppingRecipes.name: Meat Lovers
method: Mix dried oregano into the tomato sauce.
Evenly distribute all meat toppings over the cheese.

toppingRecipes.name: Vegetarian
method: Mix dried Italian herbs into the tomato sauce.
Sauté all vegetables except olives for 3-4 minutes until slightly softened.
Arrange all vegetables evenly over the cheese.
Sprinkle with fresh basil after baking.

toppingRecipes.name: Hawaiian
method: Season tomato sauce with black pepper.
Pat the pineapple chunks dry with paper towels to remove excess moisture.
Evenly distribute ham and pineapple over the cheese.

toppingRecipes.name: BBQ Chicken
method: Mix 1 tbsp of BBQ sauce with the chicken to coat it.
Use BBQ sauce as the base instead of tomato sauce.
Arrange chicken and red onion over the cheese.
If using gouda, sprinkle it on top of the mozzarella.
Add chopped cilantro after baking.

toppingRecipes.name: Four Cheese
method: Mix dried oregano into the tomato sauce.
Spread mozzarella over the sauce.
Evenly distribute blue cheese, parmesan, and dollops of goat cheese.
Sprinkle with fresh basil after baking.

toppingRecipes.name: Mushroom & Truffle
method: Sauté mushrooms with garlic, salt, and pepper until golden (about 5 minutes).
Mix ricotta with 1 tsp of truffle oil and spread over the tomato sauce.
Arrange sautéed mushrooms over the cheese.
Sprinkle with fresh thyme and parmesan.
Drizzle with remaining truffle oil after baking.

toppingRecipes.name: Buffalo Chicken

ingredients.name: (60ml) blue cheese dressing (for drizzling after baking)

method: Mix the chicken with buffalo sauce to coat thoroughly.
Arrange chicken and red onion over the cheese.
Sprinkle with blue cheese crumbles.
After baking, drizzle with blue cheese dressing and sprinkle with chives.

toppingRecipes.name: Mediterranean
method: Mix dried oregano into the tomato sauce.
Arrange artichoke hearts, sundried tomatoes, olives, and red onion over the cheese.
Sprinkle with feta cheese.
Add fresh basil after baking.

toppingRecipes.name: Spinach & Feta
method: Sauté spinach and garlic in olive oil until wilted, then drain excess moisture.
Spread spinach mixture over the cheese.
Sprinkle with feta, red onion, and pine nuts.
Add red pepper flakes if desired.

toppingRecipes.name: Pesto & Chicken
method: Use pesto as the base sauce instead of tomato sauce.
Arrange chicken, sundried tomatoes, and red onion over the cheese.
Sprinkle with pine nuts and parmesan.

toppingRecipes.name: Fig & Prosciutto
method: Brush olive oil as base instead of tomato sauce.
Dollop small spoonfuls of fig jam over the cheese.
Add goat cheese in small dollops.
After baking, arrange prosciutto slices and arugula.
Drizzle with balsamic glaze and honey.

toppingRecipes.name: Taco Pizza
method: Spread refried beans or salsa as the base.
Layer with seasoned ground beef.
Sprinkle with cheese and arrange vegetables.
After baking, top with fresh diced tomato, sour cream, guacamole, and cilantro.

toppingRecipes.name: White Pizza with Garlic & Herbs
method: Mix olive oil with minced garlic.
Blend ricotta with half the herbs, salt, and pepper.
Spread the ricotta mixture as the base.
Sprinkle with mozzarella and parmesan.
Drizzle with garlic oil.
Top with remaining fresh herbs after baking.

toppingRecipes.name: Greek Pizza
method: Mix dried oregano into the tomato sauce.
Arrange onion, bell pepper, cucumber, tomato, and olives over the cheese.
Sprinkle with feta cheese.
After baking, drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with lemon zest.

toppingRecipes.name: Seafood Pizza
method: Mix garlic and red pepper flakes into the tomato sauce.
Toss seafood with olive oil and lemon zest.
Arrange seafood and red onion over the cheese.
Sprinkle with fresh parsley after baking.

toppingRecipes.name: Caramelized Onion & Goat Cheese
method: Caramelize onions: cook over low heat with 1 tbsp olive oil for 25-30 minutes until golden and sweet.
Brush olive oil as base instead of tomato sauce.
Spread caramelized onions over the cheese.
Add dollops of goat cheese and sprinkle with thyme.
After baking, top with arugula and drizzle with balsamic glaze.

toppingRecipes.name: Breakfast Pizza
method: Spread a thin layer of tomato sauce.
Arrange bacon, onion, and bell pepper over the cheese.
Crack eggs onto the pizza, keeping yolks intact.
Season with salt and pepper.
Sprinkle with fresh chives after baking.

toppingRecipes.name: Alfredo Chicken & Broccoli
method: Mix garlic, red pepper flakes, and black pepper into the alfredo sauce.
Blanch broccoli for 2 minutes, then shock in cold water.
Arrange chicken and broccoli over the cheese.
Sprinkle with parmesan.

toppingRecipes.name: Pear & Gorgonzola
method: Brush olive oil as base instead of tomato sauce.
Arrange pear slices over the mozzarella.
Sprinkle with gorgonzola and walnuts.
After baking, add prosciutto, arugula, and drizzle with honey.

toppingRecipes.name: Eggplant Parmesan
method: Salt eggplant slices and let sit for 30 minutes to draw out moisture.
Rinse, pat dry, and roast at 400°F for 15 minutes with olive oil.
Mix dried oregano into the tomato sauce.
Arrange roasted eggplant over the cheese.
Mix breadcrumbs with parmesan and sprinkle on top.
Add fresh basil after baking.

toppingRecipes.name: Caprese

ingredients.name: Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste

method: Arrange alternating slices of tomato and mozzarella over the light tomato sauce.
Season with salt and pepper.
After baking, add fresh basil leaves.
Drizzle with balsamic glaze and olive oil.

toppingRecipes.name: Thai Chicken
method: Use peanut sauce as the base instead of tomato sauce.
Arrange chicken, bell pepper, carrot, and half the green onions over the cheese.
After baking, top with remaining green onions, chopped peanuts, cilantro.
Drizzle with lime juice and sriracha if desired.

toppingRecipes.name: French Onion
method: Caramelize onions with beef bouillon paste and Worcestershire sauce.
Brush olive oil as base instead of tomato sauce.
Spread caramelized onions over the base.
Mix the gruyère and mozzarella and sprinkle over onions.
Top with thyme and black pepper.
Add croutons in the last 2 minutes of baking.

toppingRecipes.name: Apple & Cheddar
method: Brush olive oil as base instead of tomato sauce.
Arrange apple slices over the cheddar.
Spread caramelized onions.
Sprinkle with rosemary, cinnamon, and walnuts.
Drizzle with honey after baking.

toppingRecipes.name: Bacon & Egg
method: Spread a thin layer of tomato sauce.
Sprinkle with bacon and create four wells in the cheese for the eggs.
Crack an egg into each well.
Season with black pepper and red pepper flakes if desired.
Add green onions in the last 2 minutes of baking.

toppingRecipes.name: Ratatouille
method: Toss vegetables with olive oil, garlic, and herbs de Provence.
Quickly sauté for 2-3 minutes until slightly softened.
Mix some minced garlic into the tomato sauce.
Arrange vegetables in concentric circles over the cheese.
Sprinkle with parmesan.

toppingRecipes.name: Philly Cheesesteak
method: Sauté steak, bell peppers, onion, and garlic until steak is browned and vegetables are softened.
Add Worcestershire sauce, salt, and pepper to the steak mixture.
Brush olive oil as base instead of tomato sauce.
Spread steak and vegetable mixture over the base.
Top with mozzarella and provolone cheeses.

toppingRecipes.name: Potato & Rosemary
method: Par-boil potato slices for 5 minutes, then drain and pat dry.
Mix olive oil with half the minced garlic and brush as base.
Arrange potato slices in overlapping circles.
Sprinkle with remaining garlic, rosemary, salt, and pepper.
Top with mozzarella and parmesan cheeses.

toppingRecipes.name: Shrimp Scampi
method: Sauté shrimp with garlic, red pepper flakes, olive oil, salt, and pepper until pink.
Make garlic butter by mixing 2 tbsp softened butter with 1 clove minced garlic.
Spread garlic butter as base instead of tomato sauce.
Arrange shrimp over the cheese.
Sprinkle with parmesan and lemon zest.
Add fresh parsley after baking.

toppingRecipes.name: Chicken Tikka Masala
method: Marinate chicken in 2 tbsp yogurt, 1 tsp garam masala, 1/2 tsp turmeric, and 1 tsp paprika for 30 minutes.
Cook chicken until done, then dice.
Use tikka masala sauce as the base instead of tomato sauce.
Arrange chicken, red onion, and bell pepper over the cheese.
Sprinkle with garam masala.
After baking, drizzle with yogurt and sprinkle with cilantro.

toppingRecipes.name: Jalapeño Popper
method: Mix softened cream cheese with garlic powder and onion powder.
Spread cream cheese mixture as base instead of tomato sauce.
Sprinkle with cheddar and mozzarella.
Arrange jalapeño slices and bacon over the cheese.
Top with green onions.

toppingRecipes.name: Balsamic Mushroom & Spinach
method: Sauté mushrooms with garlic, olive oil, salt, and pepper until golden.
Add balsamic vinegar and reduce slightly.
In a separate pan, sauté spinach until wilted.
Spread mushroom mixture and spinach over the cheese.
Sprinkle with parmesan and dried thyme.

toppingRecipes.name: Chorizo & Corn

ingredients.name: (60ml) lime crema (mix 1/4 cup sour cream with lime juice and zest)

method: Mix smoked paprika and cumin into the tomato sauce.
Cook chorizo until crispy, then crumble.
Arrange chorizo, corn, red onion, and bell pepper over the cheese.
After baking, drizzle with lime crema and sprinkle with cilantro.

toppingRecipes.name: Roasted Garlic & Sundried Tomato
method: Roast garlic: Cut top off garlic head, drizzle with olive oil, wrap in foil, bake at 400°F for 30-40 minutes until soft.
Squeeze roasted garlic cloves from skins and mash into a paste.
Mix some of the garlic paste into the tomato sauce.
Dot the remaining garlic paste over the cheese.
Arrange sundried tomatoes and roasted red peppers.
Sprinkle with parmesan and red pepper flakes.
Add fresh basil after baking.

toppingRecipes.name: Buffalo Cauliflower

ingredients.name: (60ml) ranch or blue cheese dressing (as base)

method: Toss cauliflower with olive oil, salt, and pepper, then roast at 425°F for 20 minutes until golden.
Toss roasted cauliflower with buffalo sauce.
Spread ranch or blue cheese dressing as base instead of tomato sauce.
Arrange cauliflower and red onion over the cheese.
Sprinkle with blue cheese.
Top with fresh chives after baking.

toppingRecipes.name: Sausage & Peppers
method: Mix dried herbs, garlic, and red pepper flakes into the tomato sauce.
Cook sausage until browned, then slice.
Sauté peppers and onions until slightly softened.
Arrange sausage, peppers, and onions over the cheese.
Sprinkle with parmesan.

toppingRecipes.name: Sweet Potato & Kale
method: Toss sweet potato slices with olive oil, cinnamon, salt, and pepper, then roast at 400°F for 15-20 minutes until tender.
Sauté kale and garlic in olive oil until kale is wilted.
Arrange sweet potato slices, kale, and red onion over the cheese.
Top with goat cheese.
Drizzle with honey after baking.

toppingRecipes.name: Bacon Cheeseburger

ingredients.name: (120ml) tomato sauce mixed with 2 tbsp mustard

method: Mix tomato sauce with mustard.
Cook ground beef until browned, season with salt and pepper.
Arrange ground beef, bacon, pickles, and red onion over the cheese.
After baking, drizzle with ketchup and mustard.
Top with shredded lettuce and sesame seeds if desired.

toppingRecipes.name: Pulled Pork BBQ
method: Use BBQ sauce as the base instead of tomato sauce.
Warm pulled pork with a bit of additional BBQ sauce.
Arrange pulled pork, red onion, and jalapeños over the cheese.
After baking, top with coleslaw and cilantro.

toppingRecipes.name: Pineapple Jalapeño
method: Pat the pineapple chunks dry with paper towels to remove excess moisture.
Arrange pineapple, jalapeños, red onion, and bacon over the cheese.
Season with black pepper.

toppingRecipes.name: Artichoke & Olive
method: Mix dried oregano and minced garlic into the tomato sauce.
Arrange artichoke hearts, olives, and red onion over the cheese.
Sprinkle with feta cheese.
Add fresh parsley after baking.

toppingRecipes.name: Asparagus & Prosciutto
method: Blanch asparagus for 2 minutes, then shock in cold water.
Brush olive oil as base instead of tomato sauce.
Arrange asparagus spears over the cheese.
After baking, lay prosciutto slices over the hot pizza.
Sprinkle with parmesan, lemon zest, thyme, and black pepper.

toppingRecipes.name: Avocado & Black Bean
method: Use salsa as the base instead of tomato sauce.
Mix black beans with cumin and chili powder.
Arrange beans, corn, red onion, and bell pepper over the cheese.
After baking, top with fresh avocado slices and cilantro.
Serve with lime wedges.

toppingRecipes.name: Brussels Sprout & Pancetta
method: Crisp pancetta in a pan, remove and set aside.
Sauté Brussels sprouts and garlic in the pancetta fat until slightly charred.
Mix olive oil with minced garlic and use as base.
Arrange Brussels sprouts and pancetta over the cheese.
Sprinkle with parmesan and red pepper flakes.
Drizzle with balsamic glaze after baking.

toppingRecipes.name: Sun-Dried Tomato & Ricotta
method: Mix ricotta with half the garlic, some basil, salt, and pepper.
Drop spoonfuls of ricotta over the light tomato sauce.
Arrange sun-dried tomatoes and roasted red peppers.
Sprinkle with mozzarella and parmesan.
Mix olive oil with remaining garlic and drizzle over top.
Add fresh basil and red pepper flakes after baking.

toppingRecipes.name: Smoked Salmon & Dill
method: Spread softened cream cheese as base instead of tomato sauce.
Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese.
After baking, arrange smoked salmon pieces, red onion, and capers.
Sprinkle with fresh dill and lemon zest.
Drizzle with olive oil and add black pepper.

toppingRecipes.name: Cuban
method: Spread yellow mustard as base instead of tomato sauce.
Layer ham and roasted pork over the cheese.
Arrange pickle slices.
Sprinkle with Swiss cheese.
Mix pickle juice with dried oregano and drizzle over top.

toppingRecipes.name: Peking Duck
method: Spread hoisin sauce as base instead of tomato sauce.
Arrange shredded duck over the cheese.
Sprinkle with five-spice powder.
After baking, top with green onions, cucumber, and cilantro.
Drizzle with sesame oil and sprinkle with sesame seeds.

toppingRecipes.name: Goat Cheese & Honey
method: Brush olive oil as base instead of tomato sauce.
Spread mozzarella and drop dollops of goat cheese.
Sprinkle with walnuts and thyme.
After baking, top with arugula.
Drizzle with honey and add black pepper.

toppingRecipes.name: Clam & Garlic
method: Mix olive oil with half the minced garlic and use as base.
Spread clams over the cheese.
Sprinkle with remaining garlic, parmesan, and red pepper flakes.
After baking, add fresh parsley, lemon zest, and black pepper.

toppingRecipes.name: Apple, Bacon & Blue Cheese
method: Brush olive oil as base instead of tomato sauce.
Arrange apple slices and caramelized onions over the cheese.
Sprinkle with bacon, blue cheese, and rosemary.
Drizzle with honey after baking.

toppingRecipes.name: Chicken Pesto Alfredo
method: Mix alfredo and pesto sauces together for the base.
Arrange chicken, sundried tomatoes, and roasted red peppers over the cheese.
Sprinkle with parmesan and pine nuts.
Add fresh basil after baking.

toppingRecipes.name: Kimchi & Pork Belly

ingredients.name: gochujang sauce mixed with 2 tbsp soy sauce (as base)

method: Mix gochujang and soy sauce for the base.
Arrange pork belly and kimchi over the cheese.
Mix honey with sesame oil and drizzle over top.
After baking, sprinkle with green onions and sesame seeds.

toppingRecipes.name: Butternut Squash & Sage
method: Toss butternut squash with olive oil, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt, and pepper, then roast at 400°F for 20 minutes until tender.
Brush olive oil as base.
Arrange butternut squash and caramelized onions over the cheese.
Sprinkle with sage and walnuts.
Drizzle with honey after baking.

toppingRecipes.name: Elote (Mexican Street Corn)

ingredients.name: (60ml) mayonnaise mixed with 1 tbsp lime juice (as base)

method: Char corn kernels in a dry skillet until slightly blackened.
Mix mayonnaise with lime juice and use as base.
Arrange charred corn, red onion, and jalapeño over the cheese.
Sprinkle with cotija cheese, chili powder, and cumin.
After baking, top with fresh cilantro.
Serve with lime wedges.

toppingRecipes.name: Lobster Thermidor

ingredients.name: Salt and white pepper to taste

method: Mix dijon mustard and brandy into the bechamel sauce.
Sauté shallots until translucent.
Mix lobster meat with half the tarragon, salt, and white pepper.
Spread bechamel as base.
Arrange lobster meat and sautéed shallots over the cheese.
Sprinkle with paprika.
After baking, add lemon zest, fresh tarragon, and chives.

toppingRecipes.name: Maple Bacon & Sweet Potato
method: Toss sweet potato slices with olive oil, cinnamon, salt, and pepper, then roast at 400°F for 15-20 minutes until tender.
Brush olive oil as base.
Arrange sweet potato slices and red onion over the cheese.
Sprinkle with bacon and thyme.
Drizzle with maple syrup before baking.
